name: trzsz-ssh
description: Simple ssh client with trzsz ( trz / tsz ) support

repo.name: trzsz-ssh
repo.description: trzsz-ssh ( tssh ) is an ssh client designed as a drop-in replacement for the openssh client. It aims to provide complete compatibility with openssh, mirroring all its features, while also offering additional useful features. Such as login prompt, batch login, remember password, automated interaction, trzsz, zmodem(rz/sz), udp mode like mosh, etc.

readme.summary: The documentation is comprehensive but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section.
readme.top_issue: Lack of a concise quick start example to get new users started with the package.

injection_risks.description: The `exec.Command` function is used with user-controlled input (`newArgs`) which can lead to command injection attacks.
The `expandTokens` function is used with user-controlled input (`localCmd`) which can lead to token expansion vulnerabilities.

critical_findings: Command injection vulnerability in the `exec.Command` function
Lack of validation for user-controlled input
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which can lead to unintended behavior or even remote code execution.

sentiment.summary: The community is moderately engaged, with issues around SSH functionality and feature requests, but no signs of significant frustration or abandonment.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth and encourage further testing.

concerns: No recent pull requests or merges indicate a lack of community contribution.
The last release was over 2 months ago.
positive_signals: Commits in the past 6 months suggest some level of activity.
Only 30 open issues and 33 closed issues within the same period, indicating manageable issue backlog.
maintenance.summary: The package shows minimal maintenance with occasional commits but no recent community contributions or releases.
